SENT.plain: Arterial manifestations of Behcet's disease consist of aneurysm formation, stenosis and occlusion
Aneurysms in Behcet's disease most commonly involve the pulmonary arteries and have been shown to resolve with medical treatment
However, this regression pattern with medical therapy has not been reported for aortic aneurysms to date
We present a 43-year-old man with bilateral abdominal aortic aneurysms resulting from Behcet's disease resolving with medical therapy
